intro: Diplomorpha ellipsocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit diplomorpha, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical fruits and delicate, opposite leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
